verses.verse: I will praise<WH3034> you<WH3068>, O Lord, with my whole heart<WH3820>; I will show forth<WH5608> all your marvelous works<WH6381>.
I will be glad<WH8055> and rejoice<WH5970> in you<WH2167>: I will sing praise to your name<WH8034>, O you most High<WH5945>.
When my enemies<WH341> are turned<WH7725> back<WH268>, they shall fall<WH3782> and perish<WH6> at your presence<WH6440>.
For you have maintained<WH6213> my right<WH4941> and my cause<WH1779>; you sat<WH3427> in the throne<WH3678> judging<WH8199> right<WH6664>.
You have rebuked<WH1605> the heathen<WH1471>, you have destroyed<WH6> the wicked<WH7563>, you have put out<WH4229> their name<WH8034> for ever<WH5769> and ever<WH5703>.
O you enemy<WH341>, destructions<WH2723> are come to a perpetual<WH5331> end<WH8552>: and you have destroyed<WH5428> cities<WH6145>; their memorial<WH2143> is perished<WH6> with them<WH1992>.
But the Lord<WH3068> shall endure<WH3427> for ever<WH5769>: he has prepared<WH3559> his throne<WH3678> for judgment<WH4941>.
And he shall judge<WH8199> the world<WH8398> in righteousness<WH6664>, he shall minister judgment<WH1777> to the people<WH3816> in uprightness<WH4339>.
The Lord<WH3068> also will be a refuge<WH4869> for the oppressed<WH1790>, a refuge<WH4869> in times<WH6256> of trouble<WH6869>.
And they that know<WH3045> your name<WH8034> will put their trust<WH982> in you<WH3068>: for you, Lord, have not forsaken<WH5800> them that seek you<WH1875>.
Sing praises<WH2167> to the Lord<WH3068>, which dwells<WH3427> in Zion<WH6726>: declare<WH5046> among the people<WH5971> his doings<WH5949>.
When he makes inquisition<WH1875> for blood<WH1818>, he remembers<WH2142> them<WH7911>: he forgets not the cry<WH6818> of the humble<WH6035>.
Have mercy<WH2603> upon me<WH3068>, O Lord; consider<WH7200> my trouble<WH6040> which I suffer of them that hate<WH8130> me<WH7311>, you that lift me up from the gates<WH8179> of death<WH4194>:
That I may show forth<WH5608> all your praise<WH8416> in the gates<WH8179> of the daughter<WH1323> of Zion<WH6726>: I will rejoice<WH1523> in your salvation<WH3444>.
The heathen<WH1471> are sunk down<WH2883> in the pit<WH7845> that they made<WH6213>: in the net<WH7568> which<WH2098> they hid<WH2934> is their own foot<WH7272> taken<WH3920>.

The Lord<WH3068> is known<WH3045> by the judgment<WH4941> which he executes<WH6213>: the wicked<WH7563> is snared<WH5367> in the work<WH6467> of his own hands<WH3709>. Higgaion<WH1902>. Selah<WH5542>.
The wicked<WH7563> shall be turned<WH7725> into hell<WH7585>, and all the nations<WH1471> that forget<WH7913> God<WH430>.
For the needy<WH34> shall not always<WH5331> be forgotten<WH7911>: the expectation<WH8615> of the poor<WH6041> shall not perish<WH6> for ever<WH5703>.
Arise<WH6965>, O Lord<WH3068>; let not man<WH582> prevail<WH5810>: let the heathen<WH1471> be judged<WH8199> in your sight<WH6440>.
Put<WH7896> them in fear<WH4172>, O Lord<WH3068>: that the nations<WH1471> may know<WH3045> themselves to be but men<WH582>. Selah<WH5542>.
